import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { PieChart } from 'ai-verify-shared-library/charts';


export const ib_cid = "flexibility";

export const Recommendation = ({ data02 }) => {
  const responses = data02.map(item => item.name);
  const yesCount = data02.find(item => item.name === 'Yes')?.value || 0;
  const noCount = data02.find(item => item.name === 'No')?.value || 0;
  const naCount = data02.find(item => item.name === 'Not Applicable')?.value || 0; 

  let recommendation;
  if (noCount >= 1 || naCount >= 1) {
    //Failed Test
    recommendation = "The market will tend to more positive outcomes if the AI systems are interoperable with one another and there are no/little barriers introduced by developers or deployers to impede users from uploading/downloading, extracting and porting their information to rival services. For the market to be more competitive, the best products and services should win out and not be restricted by anti-competitive tying or bundling. Additionally, vertical integration and partnerships should not be a means of insulating firms from competition. The company could consider increasing the interoperability of its AI system such that users may easily switch or multi-home to benefit from the diversity in AI model offerings. The company should avoid engaging in tying/bundling or implementing high switching cost for its customers. If the company considers itself to be dominant, it should review the AI algorithm to avoid potentially infringing Section 47 of the Competition Act, which prohibits the abuse of a dominant market position that is not based on fair competition and perpetuates the dominant position of the business.";
  } else {
    //Passed Test
    recommendation = "The market will tend to more positive outcomes if the AI systems are interoperable with one another and there are no/little barriers introduced by developers or deployers to impede users from uploading/downloading, extracting and porting their information to rival services. For the market to be more competitive, the best products and services should win out and not be restricted by anti-competitive tying or bundling. Additionally, vertical integration and partnerships should not be a means of insulating firms from competition. The company has ensured that its AI model is interoperable with other systems. It has also taken steps to avoid locking consumers into a single ecosystem, and does not engage in anti-competitive tying or bundling practices.";
  }

  return (
    <div className="recommendation">
      <h3 className="c-primary">Our Recommendation:</h3>
      <div style={{paddingTop: "5px"}}>{recommendation}</div>
    </div>
  );
};

export const MissingCriteria = ({ data }) => {
    const questionsDict = {
        "3_1_1": "3.1.1 AI company should consider for AI model to support open and standardized input formats such that it can be interoperable with other AI systems.",
        "3_1_2": "3.1.2 Ensure that AI model adheres to data portability standards and best practices.",
        "3_1_3": "3.1.3 AI company should consider providing tools for seamless data migration of trained parameters, eliminating the need to retrain the AI model, promoting interoperability.",
        "3_2_1": "3.2.1 Ensure that the AI company provides transparent and easily understandable information about the costs and requirements associated with switching.",
        "3_2_2": "3.2.2 Ensure provisions are in place to facilitate the portability of data and configurations when switching to or from the AI model, minimizing data migration expenses.",
        "3_2_3": "3.2.3 Having clear exit strategies enable consumers to switch AI models without being unduly tied to a specific provider.",
        "3_3_1": "3.3.1 Ensure that the AI model's licensing or usage agreements does not mandate the use of specific cloud services for deployment or operation.",
        "3_3_2": "3.3.2 Ensure that the AI company offers its AI models as independent products, and consumers are able select and utilize individual AI models without being obligated to purchase or use other bundled products.",
    };

    const noResponses = data
        .filter(response => response.response === 'No')
        .map(response => response.id);

    const missingCriteriaQuestions = noResponses.map(id => questionsDict[id] || "Question not found");

    return (
        <div style={{ paddingLeft: "10px", paddingRight: "10px", paddingTop: "15px" }}>
            <h3 className="c-primary">Company did not implement the following testable criteria fully:</h3>
            <ul style={{ paddingLeft: "13px", paddingRight: "0px", marginTop: "5px" }}>
                {missingCriteriaQuestions.map((question, index) => (
                    <li key={index} style={{ paddingBottom: "9px" }}>
                        {question}
                    </li>
                ))}
            </ul>
        </div>
    );
}

export const MyComponent = (props) => {
    const [data02, setData02] = useState([]);
    const [dataWithIds, setDataWithIds] = useState([]);

    useEffect(() => {
        const responses = [
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_1_1"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_1_2"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_1_3"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_2_1"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_2_2"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_2_3"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_3_1"],
            props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_3_2"]
        ];

        const yesCount = responses.filter(response => response === 'Yes').length;
        const noCount = responses.filter(response => response === 'No').length;
        const naCount = responses.filter(response => response === 'NA').length;

        setData02([
            { name: "Not Applicable", value: naCount }, // Blue
            { name: "No", value: noCount }, // Orange
            { name: "Yes", value: yesCount } // Green
        ]);

        const ids = [
            "3_1_1", "3_1_2", "3_1_3", "3_2_1", "3_2_2", "3_2_3", "3_3_1", "3_3_2"
        ];

        const responseswithID = ids.map(id => ({
            id: id,
            response: props.getIBData(ib_cid)[id]
        }));

        setDataWithIds(responseswithID);

    }, [props]);

// for grid display - display: "grid", gridTemplateColumns: "1fr 1fr", gap: "0px", padding: "0px" 
// for donut chart - pies={[{ dataKey: "value", data: data02, innerRadius: 65, outerRadius: 120, labelLine: false, label: "renderCustomizedPieLabel" }]} 

    return (
        <div style={{ width:"100%"}}>
            <div className="aiv-panel">
                <h2>CCCS Recommendations</h2>
            </div>
            <div style={{ padding:"10px", textAlign: "center" }}>
                <h2 className="c-primary">Principle: Flexibility (Competition)</h2>
            </div>
            <h4 style={{paddingLeft: "10px", paddingRight: "10px"}}>
                The outcome of this principle is to ensure that the AI model is interoperable with other AI systems, and that there are no/little barriers introduced by developers or deployers to impede users from uploading/downloading, extracting and porting their information to rival services. Additionally, vertical integration and partnerships should not be a means of insulating firms from competition.
            </h4>
            <div style={{ height:"400px", padding:"5px" }}>
                <PieChart
                    pies={[{ dataKey: "value", data: data02, labelLine: false, label: "renderCustomizedPieLabel" }]} 
                />
            </div>
            <div style={{ paddingLeft: "10px", paddingRight: "10px", paddingTop: "10px"}}>
                <Recommendation data02={data02} />
            </div>
            <div style={{paddingLeft: "10px", paddingRight: "10px", paddingTop: "15px"}}>
                <h3 className="c-primary">Summmary Justification:</h3>
                <div style={{paddingTop: "3px"}}>{props.getIBData(ib_cid)["3_summary"]}</div>
            </div>
            <div>
                <MissingCriteria data={dataWithIds} />
            </div>
        </div>
    );
};

export default MyComponent;
